text: Wee Pine Knot is a historic house at 319 Spring Street in Sulphur Springs, Benton County, Arkansas. It is a single-story wood frame structure, finished in peeled-log and half-timbered siding. The house, and an accompanying garage finished with log siding, were built in 1918-19 by Warren Prickett as a summer house. Its front porch is built up out of stacked rock, including its support piers and a half-wall, and the same material is used at the base of the chimney. The interior of the house features Craftsman style woodwork and pine flooring. It is a distinctive local example of Craftsman and Rustic style architecture. The house was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1999. ==See also== *National Register of Historic Places listings in Benton County, Arkansas ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Arkansas Category:Houses completed in 1919 Category:Houses in Benton County, Arkansas Category:National Register of Historic Places in Benton County, Arkansas
title: Wee Pine Knot
